sn_aia_agent_tool_m2m.description:
Purpose The Automated Case Generation via Classification (ACGA) tool is responsible for instantly formalizing the customer's request into a structured support case in the target system. It leverages the precise classification data from the preceding step to ensure accurate and immediate case record creation, thereby initiating the workflow for fulfillment.
Data Prerequisites Before executing this step, the AI Agent must have successfully run the Customer Look-Up Tool and the Disruption Service Case Lookup Tool to secure required reference numbers. Crucially, the Specialized Case Classification (Step 4) must have determined the exact case type and system IDs.
Input Parameters and Context Parameter: interaction Source: Interaction Record (Primary Input): The definitive record of the customer interaction. Use: Need to link the interaction to the new case for auditing purposes
Parameter Name: table_name Source: Specialized Case Classification (Step 4) - this will be found under Service Definition Table Use: Provides the table that has been determined for processing MANDATORY CONSIDERATION - Must match the predefined return format exactly, e.g., sn_bom_treasury_wire_service
Parameter Name: business_activity Source: Specialized Case Classification (Step 4) - this will be found under Service Definition SysID Use: Provides the specific business activity that has been determined for processing MANDATORY CONSIDERATION - Must match the predefined return format exactly, e.g., f565708f2fec7a50b14f861cbfa4e359
Parameter Name: summary Source: Agent's Discretion Use: To provide a high-level, actionable subject line for the case (e.g., "Flight cancellation requires tour date shift").
Parameter Name: description Source: Agent's Discretion Use: To provide a detailed overview of the core issue and classification.
Parameter Name: workNotes Source: Agent's Discretion Use: To provide a complete, actionable summary of the interaction so far, ensuring a human agent can seamlessly take over without needing the customer to repeat information.
Actions & Logic Case Creation: The tool initiates an API call to the target system, instantly creating a new support case record.
Field Population: It strictly uses the classification outputs and provided input parameters to pre-populate all relevant fields. It ensures that the Case Table and Business Activity ID adhere strictly to the system's predefined format, which is necessary for the post-creation routing logic to execute correctly.
Contextual Documentation: The provided summary and description are used to fully document the case record, offering immediate clarity on the nature and context of the request for the human agent who will manage it next.
Key Outputs Determined The main output is the New Case Reference Number generated by the target system for the newly created support record, confirming successful case instantiation.
sn_aia_agent_tool_m2m.name: Automated Case Generation via Classification (ACGA)

tool.display_value: Create new case record via classification
